poem:
Title: Vestiges of Conflict

Though scrabbled papers report a mission done,
it is the quiet whisper of another sun;
Silhouetted remnants of an ancient tale,
peppered with votes and finance's scale. 
On the map's creased forehead, a Palestine weeps,
while Israel, proud in the ink, their promise keeps.
Confetti of conquest, hushed aftermath,
shades of grey in the war's lost aftermath.
